name: balaena-mysticetus
definition: The bowhead whale  is a species of baleen whale belonging to the family Balaenidae and the only living representative of the genus Balaena.
description:
The bowhead whale has this name due to its bow-shaped mouth.

It is black with a whitish patch on its chin, which features a necklace of spots that are black.

The bowhead whale lacks a dorsal fin.

Its coloring is dark gray to black and it is the longest of all baleen whales.

It is usually observed as two bumps above the water, being its head and its back.

The blow or spout comes from two widely-spaced blowholes, a bushy V seven meters high.

The bowhead is the only whale of the baleens to spend its whole life in arctic and sub-arctic seas.

The Alaskan population winter in the southwestern Bering Sea.

This group migrates north in the spring, following the openings it finds in the ice, to the Beaufort and Chukchi seas.

In summer they are found in straits, bays and estuaries.

Bowhead whales eat mostly zooplankton, including copepods and little shrimp-like animals about 1 to 3 millimeters long called euphausiids.

Besides humans, main predators of bowhead whales are killer whales.

Bowhead whales are polyandrous, one female having relationship with one or more males.

Sexual activity takes place between pairs and in lively groups of several males with one or two females.

Mating usually takes place from late winter to early spring.

After a gestation lasting 13 to 14 months, one calf is born.

It is fed with milk from its mother until it is weaned, this occurring 9 to 15 months after birth.

Once the births have taken place, whales divide into groups to migrate.

Mothers with their calves are in the group at the front.

This could be to enable them to be first to feed on food that is encountered.

The birthing interval is 3 to 4 years.

Sexual maturity may not be attained until they are 20 years old.

Bowhead whales swim slowly and usually travel on their own or in small herds with up to 6 animals.

They may stay beneath the surface for up to forty minutes for a dive, but they are not regarded as deep divers.

They are highly vocal, using underwater sounds to communicate when traveling, feeding and socializing.

Bowheads can make long repetitive songs, which could be mating displays.

This whale’s behavior includes breaching, spy-hopping and tail slapping.

A behavior unique to this species is that it will use its exceptionally large head to break through ice, especially pieces that are thick.

facts.name: Main predator is killer whale
facts.value: Besides humans, main predators of bowhead whales are killer whales.

facts.name: Reach 14 to 18 meters length
facts.value: Bowhead whale can reach 14 to 18 meters in length and 50 to 60 tons of weight. Females are slightly larger than males.

facts.name: Pregnancy lasts 13 to 14 months
facts.value: Pregnancy in females lasts 13 to 14 months and ends with one baby (calf). Young bowhead whale has 3.3 to 5.4 meters in length and 900 kilograms of weight at birth. It depends on the mother's milk 9 to 12 months.

facts.name: Dark bluish-black color
facts.value: Bowhead whales have dark bluish-black color of the skin with white patches on the jaw, belly and tail.

facts.name: Stocky body with large head
facts.value: Bowhead whale has stocky body with extremely large head. Jaw is arched and it looks like a bow (hence the name "bowhead"). Bowhead whale does not have dorsal fin.

facts.name: Able to break thick layer of ice
facts.value: Bowhead whales are able to break 30 centimeters thick layer of ice to create breathing holes. They can stay 40 minutes under the water without returning to the surface to breathe.

facts.name: Bowhead has baleen plates
facts.value: Mouth of bowhead whale is equipped with baleen plates that can reach 450 centimeters in length. Bowhead whale filters the food from the sea water using these plates.

facts.name: Can survive up to 200 years
facts.value: According to the latest scientific analysis, bowhead whales can survive up to 200 years in the wild.

facts.name: Sexual maturity at the age of 20 years
facts.value: Bowhead whales reach sexual maturity at the age of 20 years and reproduce slowly, every 3 to 4 years. Because of that, reduced population of bowhead whales in the wild cannot be returned to the previous level easily.

facts.name: Travel on their own or in the groups
facts.value: Bowhead whales travel on their own or in the groups of up to six animals.

facts.name: Two blowholes on the top of the head
facts.value: Bowhead whale has two blowholes on the top of the head. V-shaped blow of condensed air can reach 6 meters in height.

facts.name: Can mate throughout the whole year
facts.value: Although bowhead whales can mate throughout the whole year, mating usually takes place from late winter to early spring. Majority of babies is born during the spring and early summer.

facts.name: Has 45 centimeters layer of blubber
facts.value: Bowhead whale has 45 centimeters thick layer of blubber that protects it from freezing in the cold Arctic waters.

facts.name: Produce sounds for communication
facts.value: Bowhead whales produce different sounds that are used for communication during migration (from summer to winter habitats) and mating season.

facts.name: Diet consists of zooplankton
facts.value: Diet of bowhead whale consists of zooplankton and small fish. Bowhead whale can eat 10 metric tons of crustaceans each year.

related.definition: The blue whale  is a marine mammal belonging to the baleen whale parvorder, Mysticeti.
The killer whale or orca  is a toothed whale belonging to the oceanic dolphin family, of which it is the largest member.
The beluga whale   is an Arctic and sub-Arctic cetacean.
The narwhal is a medium-sized toothed whale that possesses a large tusk from a protruding canine tooth.
The gray whale is a baleen whale that migrates between feeding and breeding grounds yearly.
